headline: Churros
description: Churros, sweet Mexican fritters rolled in cinnamon sugar, are easy to make. They're excellent as-is, or serve them with chocolate sauce for dipping.

video.description: See how to make a simple Mexican pastry.
video.name: Churros

name: Churros
recipeIngredient: 0.5 cup white sugar, or to taste

recipeInstructions.text: Combine water, 2 1/2 tablespoons sugar, salt, and 2 tablespoons vegetable oil in a small saucepan and place over medium heat. Bring to a boil and remove from the heat. Stir in flour, stirring until mixture forms a ball.
Heat oil for frying in a deep fryer or deep pot to 375 degrees F (190 degrees C).

Transfer the dough to a sturdy pastry bag fitted with a medium star tip. Carefully pipe a few 5- to 6-inch strips of dough into the hot oil; work in batches so you don't crowd the fryer. Cook until golden; use a spider or slotted spoon to transfer churros to paper towels to drain.
Combine 1/2 cup sugar and cinnamon. Roll drained churros in cinnamon and sugar mixture.

review.reviewBody: i absolutely loved this recipe I recommend for everyone loved dipping in chocolate melt if you have a sweet tooth good to share
I LOVED IT!!!!
Churros came out okay overall, very chewy. Not enough flavor. Siblings liked them though.
These were delicious. The first time I did not boil them and it turned in to like a crepe mixture but the second time they were amazing. I definitely recommend.

They were pretty good, It really depends on the width of the churros, mine were undercooked so I deep fried them at medium-high heat, they look quite dark but they were pretty cooked on the inside. Should've added vanilla flavoring (still good without) It was very good!
So good really easy to make
Came out perfectly.
My kids love this recipe and are always wanting me to make them. I recommend doing a double batch because they wonâ€™t last long. ðŸ˜‹

Quick easy to follow recipe. I reduced the sugar sprinkles to only 2 tbsp and the cinnamon sugar ratio to suit my taste.

Disappointing, to say the least. This is essentially a waffle dough and is so thick thereâ€™s no possible way to pipe it. It has zero flavor and wonâ€™t cook all the way through without the exterior of the churros burning.

Even though I did not follow the exact recipe and made a few slip ups, it still turned out amazing! I recommend using this recipe. But sometimes, it might turn out too sweet so be careful of that.

I baked them in the oven with oil on them. They are REALLY good!
Sooo delicious. Nice easy treat!
Worse churros ever! Raw dough, tasteless.

Love them. I used an air fryer to make them a tad healthier. After the dough was done, I piped the churros and placed them on top of wax paper and into the fridge for about 45 min. Once cooled, I put the churros in the air fryer at 370 for about 10-12 min and flipped them at the 5 min mark.
I think it was really good and did not take much time to make loved it.
This is a family hit! The girls keep asking me to make it for them and itâ€™s sooooooo simple to make.
Absolutely yummy and easy!

We love these. Easy to make but quadrupled the recipe. No sense taking out the deep fryer for just a few.
Tasted amazing and hade a nice soft inside

Attempted without success. Dough far to thick to pipe and used a Star attachment about 3 cm, it would have not gone through anything smaller. At the temperature stated outside cooked perfectly and center was raw. So stopped and regrouped and cut the pipped dough in to thinner sections. Only until they were about 2-3 cm thick cooked did they come out correctly. This was dropping to about 300 F. Lots of work. Also not light and fluffy like restaurant type but more heavy and hard. Bon appetite.
I didn't follow the recipe as it is, made some slight changes and the churros came out amazing.
super easy and delicious!

Used my piping bag without a tip (don't think any my tips are big enough) just used the plastic tip holder. These were really easy and super good. 1 batch didn't make too much.

very tasty!
These were amazing!!!! The recipient was easy and quick!! We ate them with hot fudge and ice cream. It was a perfect summer treat!!!
I made them into balls because I didn't have a piping bag and they were still AMAZING!!

Omg, takes me back to a time when I would get these when traveling to TJ and look for the little street vendors. Same taste and all. Our family is bi racial and my kids no little of these foods, but shared this with them and my wife and they loved it instantly and asked me to make them a again two days in a row; simple to make and great instructions.
I tired this and my family actually loves it I totally recommend it for anyone who wants to try it. just make sure you do the oil the right way

The recipe is absolutely insane! Itâ€™s just amazing! It says to boil the water in the recipe but my water never boiled because of the oil but as long as itâ€™s extremely hot it will be fine. Also it says one cup flour I had to add three cups flour because adding all the oil and sugar it was too watery so I added more for a more thick version. But the end resolute was fantastic and I shared them with my neighbors and they loved it

Omg I cannot explain these churros they are super good.
It is the BOM

The churros would not cook properly, they were raw on the inside and overcooked on the outside. They didnâ€™t taste like churros either.
Made them exactly as the directions stated and they were delicious my kids loved them!!!

I followed Cat's revision of the recipe and the churros came out great. Definitely will make more of these in the coming future !

BEWARE!!!This recipe tells you to pipe.... do not pipe! Also make sure your churros are skinny and small... otherwise they explode. i now have 2nd degree burns covering my right hand and wrist and will take months to recover. Very dangerous! im lucky my child was not near stove and that it wasnt my face!
it was fun to try and make but I burned myself many times for it to not work at all.
I made it just the same way and it was amazing I will definitely try it again
Aside from the sugar and cinnamon these tasted nothing like a churro!

First time I've made churros. This dough was very thick to pipe through my piping bag. It went through 3 disposable bags. It keep causing the bag to expand when it was not ment to. The dough was also semi cool. Not sure what went wrong. The doughs flavor was not ideal for me either. I've had loads of churros in my life and this just doesn't hit the spot for me. If it was user error please provide clearer instructions. Thank you.

The recipe didnâ€™t call for eggs which is a very important ingredient. I made it with 3 extra eggs beaten in at the end. This is basically just a choux pastry that gets fried so eggs are a very important ingredient. They are delicious when made with eggs :)
It's exceptional recipe! I made them, and used a cookie press for tulumbe, and they were awesome. For years I've been forcing myself to make them, and now my household is addicted!
kids loved them. The dough was very dense, and hard to pipe through the nozzle...but it's a super quick and delicious snack!
Super easy to make, only thing I changed with this recipe is that I added 2 egg yolks. Keep in mind u need to let the dough cool before u add the egg yolks so they don't cook.
I will definitely make these again followed the recipe as instructed my family loved them. Next time I will double the recipe, good job.
i very love churros recipe
Perfect. So delicious
I will not make this again, it was not edible... I followed the recipe exactly...
I followed this recipe and they were so good. Great with coffe or cocoa.

This is the best little snack that has many flavors, and the inside tastes like yummy, warm cake... I LOVE THIS

One thing; wait 5 minutes before squishing the dough into the deep fryer :)
They were very chewy and there couldâ€™ve been more flavor to it since Iâ€™ve eaten churros before it wasnâ€™t close to that taste.

This was a really easy, fun, and delicious recipe. It also did not take very long. I piped my churros thin and I would recommend that because then they don't take as long to fry. I would also recommend rolling them in the cinnamon-sugar right after they are done frying. I loved this recipe.
After experimenting with other recipes this one is by far the bottom of my list. Thereâ€™s just no substitute for vanilla and eggs with butter.
my family loved them
Delicious recipe and very easy to make. I rolled the dough since I did not have a pastry bag and it worked well.

I made this yesterday with the modifications that Cat suggested. It was amazing! for anyone who doesn't want to make/use a pastry bag I did let the dough cool for a little bit after mixing with a spatula so i could take chunks from the dough and roll it out on a board with my hands. 

In my first batch, the sticks were way too thick so crispy/doughy ratio was a little off. Once I made them shorter and a lot skinnier they tasted perfect (make them to your own taste of course). This probably can be easier if you have some type of churro maker or a pastry bag with a star tip so you can get more the edges fried.

I also like another's suggestion to fry it at a lower heat for a bit longer cause I did like my dough a little more cooked on the inside - it will take a bit longer to brown. Also, if you're a beginner to deep frying - don't fill up your pot that high or oil will spill out of it!
would not recommend

this is the best curros of all time i did not spell curros wrong

I was so excited to try this recipe but was disappointed. I've never tasted a traditional churro so I cannot compare ( I liked Costco when they sold it st their concession and I absolutely love the ones from Jack in the box) This was not as airy and the dough had no taste. I tried 3 different batches, changing the temperature each time. I had no thermometer but was able to judge by the doughiness in each. I did roll it by hand but don't think it was an issue. I cut the sugar and oil in the dough as suggested by some. I will try adding vanilla the next time and maybe follow the recipe exactly how it's written. Yes there will be a next time!
